result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clifton D Mitchell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Clifton D Mitchell appeared by video.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt appeared by video for Clifton D Mitchell.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requested projected plea and sentencing date. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 16; IN PERSON. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-15-22

Defendant Clifton D Mitchell in court with Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Defendant Clifton D Mitchell in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Officer C. George. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Retainer received and filed.  bm

Adjustment Number: 22A 069915,
Payable Number: 1021789,
Receipt Number: 22RP029864,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Clifton D Mitchell in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Clifton D Mitchell in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Clifton D Mitchell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
